0.title: 6 die in Haryana's Sonipat, Mahendragarh during Ganesh idol immersion; CM expresses grief
0.article_body: Four people died in Mahendragarh while two others died in Sonipat in Haryana during the Lord Ganesha idol immersion on Friday. Nine youths had been swept away in a canal in Mahendragarh. While four died, others were rescued. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar expressed his condolences. "We...stand with the families of...deceased in this difficult time," he wrote on Twitter.

1.title: Pilot announces Queen Elizabeth II's death before landing in London, video surfaces
1.article_body: A video of a British Airways pilot making a mid-flight announcement about the death of Queen Elizabeth II has surfaced online. "The Queen passed away earlier today...I thought at the moment I should at least tell you...because I know many will be very, very sad about this," the pilot said 40 minutes before landing at the Heathrow Airport in London.

2.title: Max Verstappen, AlphaTauri's Tsunoda get grid penalties for Italian GP
2.article_body: Red Bull F1 driver Max Verstappen is set to reportedly take another grid penalty during the 2022 Italian GP for changing an engine component. AlphaTauri's Yuki Tsunoda has meanwhile been confirmed to get a 10-place penalty for accumulating reprimands from the race stewards. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton, Haas' Mick Schumacher and Alfa Romeo's Valtteri Bottas are also taking penalties.

3.title: Liverpool looking to replace Jurgen Klopp with Luis Enrique: Report
3.article_body: Liverpool are reportedly looking to replace manager Jurgen Klopp with Spain national team head coach Luis Enrique emerging as the frontrunner for the post. Liverpool have managed to win only two matches from seven games across all competitions this season. A report claimed Liverpool have already contacted Enrique but Klopp might be given time till January.

4.title: MakeMyTrip announces India’s 15 most-loved homestays of 2022
4.article_body: MakeMyTrip shared that it has released the list of India's Favourite Homestays Awards (IFHA) winners in association with The Times of India. Chosen by 5,00,000+ consumer votes across India and assessed by an expert jury that included Twinkle Khanna, this list of 15 homestays in India is a must-try for your next vacation, said MakeMyTrip.

5.title: ₹32 lakh seized after ED raids on Punjab MLA, others in bank fraud case
5.article_body: The ED on Friday seized hard drives and ₹32 lakh in cash after raiding the premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra and others. Raids were conducted on directors of Tara Corporation Limited and their associates in an alleged bank loan fraud. The ED said the accused inflated TCL's turnover through "bogus firms" and siphoned off loan funds.

6.title: India's kharif rice output to fall due to less sowing area: Govt
6.article_body: India's rice production could decrease by around 6.5 million tonnes during this year's Kharif season due to reduction in sowing area, the government said. However, the government asserted there will be surplus output. On Thursday, a ban on exporting broken rice was imposed. Further, export duty of 20% on non-basmati rice was also imposed.

7.title: Direct tax collection rose by 35% this fiscal till Sep 8: IT data
7.article_body: Direct tax collection, which includes personal income tax, increased by 35.46% to ₹6.48 lakh crore in the current financial year till September 8, according to the Income Tax (IT) Department's data. Direct tax collection after net refunds stood at ₹5.29 lakh crore. The country's GDP growth was at 13.5% in the first quarter of this fiscal ending June 30, 2022.

8.title: WHO launching $1.5 billion campaign against meningitis in Africa
8.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) said it is launching a $1.5 billion campaign to eliminate bacterial meningitis across Africa by 2030. WHO Regional Director, Africa, Matshidiso Moeti said "a next generation" vaccine against meningitis will be available in the worst-affected countries. Over 50 million African children had their meningitis vaccinations delayed due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

9.title: Section 144 imposed in J&K's Rajouri due to 'communal tension'
9.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration imposed prohibitory orders under Section 144 in Rajouri town on Friday citing “communal tension”. The decision was taken following a group's procession call after Friday prayers over a land dispute. With the order, the assembly of four or more people in public places has been restrained.

10.title: Sweden set for election on Sep 11 amid concerns over energy bills
10.article_body: Sweden is set for Parliamentary elections on Sunday, with rising energy costs due to the Russia-Ukraine war and violent crimes at home being the most-discussed topics. Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson of the Social Democrats currently enjoys a high approval rating. Andersson became Sweden's first female prime minister less than a year ago.

11.title: Chinese shadowing our warships in South China Sea: Australia
11.article_body: Australia's Navy chief Vice Admiral Mark Hammond on Friday said the Chinese Navy's "unusual behaviour" of shadowing Australian warships in South China Sea hadn't deterred operations. "Routinely whenever we have a ship up there, there's a PLA (People's Liberation Army) navy vessel...following us around," he said. Hammond was speaking ahead of next week's multination naval exercise 'Kakadu'.

12.title: EU & Thailand seal partnership deal ending years of strained ties
12.article_body: The European Union (EU) and Thailand sealed a Partnership and Cooperation Agreement (PCA) on Friday, as both sides make efforts to repair relations which were strained following a military coup in Bangkok in 2014. This is the EU's sixth PCA agreement with a Southeast Asian country. The PCA improves bilateral ties on multiple issues, including human rights, and counterterrorism.

13.title: Saba shares dad Mansoor's pic with Queen Elizabeth II, says 'End of an era'
13.article_body: Late Indian cricketer Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi's daughter Saba Pataudi took to Instagram to share a picture of him with Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away on Thursday. "An end of an Era. R.I.P #queenelizabeth...She'll be remembered. #Lord's #cricket #ground," she wrote. In the picture, Mansoor is seen standing next to the Queen, as she shook hands with other cricketers.

14.title: Former Union Ministers, ex-CMs handed state party roles by BJP
14.article_body: The BJP has announced in-charges, co-in-charges and 'prabharis' for 15 states, including poll-bound northeast states. National General Secretary Tarun Chugh is now the new Telangana 'prabhari', while former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb has been appointed for Haryana. Sambit Patra is the coordinator for northeast states and former I&B minister Prakash Javadekar is the 'prabhari' for Kerala.

15.title: 4 children drown in UP's Aami river during immersion of Ganesh idol
15.article_body: Four children drowned in Aami river in Uttar Pradesh's Sant Kabir Nagar during the immersion of Ganesh idol on Friday, police officials said. The bodies were recovered with the help of fishermen and have been sent for postmortem. The deceased were identified as six-year-old Pauphia, six-year-old Ajit, eight-year-old Ruby and 11-year-old Dipali, Superintendent of Police said.

16.title: King Charles delivers 1st speech as British monarch, says 'My mother was an inspiration'
16.article_body: King Charles III delivered his first speech as Britain's monarch on Friday and paid tribute to his mother Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away aged 96. "Throughout her life...my beloved mother was an inspiration and example to me and...all my family," said Charles. "We owe her the most heartfelt debt any family can owe to their mother," he added.

17.title: I'd love Carlos Alcaraz to win 30 Grand Slams: Coach Juan Carlos
17.article_body: Praising world number four Carlos Alcaraz after he reached his maiden Grand Slam semi-final at US Open, his coach Juan Carlos said, "I'd love for him to win 30 Grand Slams. He has a chance of winning many." He added, "First step is to win the first." The 19-year-old beat 11th-seeded Jannik Sinner in five hours 15 minutes in quarter-final.

18.title: One of the best: Patrick on Alcaraz-Sinner's 5hr 15min US Open quarter-final
18.article_body: Commenting on the quarter-final match between Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner at US Open 2022, Simona Halep's coach Patrick Mouratoglou said it was probably "one of the best matches" he has seen in a long time. Alcaraz beat Sinner 6-3, 6-7(7-9), 6-7(0-7), 7-5, 6-3 in five hours 15 minutes. It was the second-longest match in the history of US Open.

19.title: What is the protocol for internet shutdowns?: SC to Centre
19.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the Centre whether there is a protocol for internet shutdowns. The apex court was hearing a plea which alleged arbitrary internet shutdowns in Arunachal Pradesh, Gujarat, Rajasthan and West Bengal. The SC bench said instead of issuing notices to the four states, notice should be sent to the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

20.title: Congress should refuel in BJP states during 'Bharat Jodo': HS Puri
20.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has "advised" the Congress to refuel their vehicles in BJP-ruled states to save money during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Congress leaders can save around ₹1,050 to ₹2,205 per diesel vehicle while traversing through 12 states- 3,500 km," said Puri's tweet. He tweeted a graphic which claimed that fuel in BJP-ruled states is comparatively cheaper.

21.title: PM Modi discusses energy, climate, blue economy with Norwegian PM
21.article_body: PM Narendra Modi had a telephone conversation with his Norwegian counterpart Jonas Gahr Støre on Friday. They discussed bilateral and international issues including initiatives to mobilise climate finance for renewable energy projects in developing countries. "[They discussed their] cooperation in the fields of...climate...investments and blue economy," the Norwegian Prime Minister's Office said.

22.title: Sri Lanka defeat Pakistan in Super 4 stage ahead of their Asia Cup 2022 final
22.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the last Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. Put into bat first, Pakistan were dismissed for 121, with Sri Lanka spinner Wanindu Hasaranga registering bowling figures of 4-0-21-3. Sri Lanka chased down the target in 17 overs, with their opener Pathum Nissanka scoring an unbeaten 55 off 48 deliveries.

23.title: Pakistan rehire Matthew Hayden as mentor for T20 World Cup
23.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board has rehired former Australia cricketer Matthew Hayden as the team mentor for the ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. Hayden had an earlier stint with Pakistan during last year's T20 World Cup in UAE. "I welcome Matthew Hayden...He is a proven performer with his credentials acknowledged and recognised world-over," said PCB Chairman Ramiz Raja.

24.title: Last year was very new experience, balancing was difficult: Neeraj Chopra
24.article_body: Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra said commercial obligations and social commitments took a toll on him last year but he has learnt from his experience. "Last year was a very new experience for me, balancing was difficult," said Chopra. He added that during the off-season he worked on his technique, which helped him win the Diamond League final.

25.title: What are Kohli and Sachin's all-format stats after 71 international hundreds?
25.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday smashed his 71st hundred in his 522nd innings in international cricket. Sachin Tendulkar had reached 71 international hundreds in 523 innings. Kohli scored 24,002 runs in his first 522 innings in international cricket, while Sachin had aggregated 23,274 runs in his first 523 innings. Kohli's average after 71 international hundreds is 53.81, while Sachin's was 49.51.

26.title: India already united: Anurag Thakur on Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
26.article_body: Criticising the Congress over 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Friday said India is already united under PM Narendra Modi's leadership. "The double-engine (BJP) government in both the Centre and State has worked together to take the state and country forward," Thakur said. "We can't let the country get divided and must work with unity," he added.

27.title: My English has improved but is not very good yet: Neeraj Chopra
27.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, who became the first Indian to win Diamond Trophy on Thursday, said his English has improved but isn't "very good" yet. "However...I've learnt it to a point where I understand what others want to say...make others understand what I want to say. Athletics is a global sport & knowing basics help," he added.

28.title: India's WC-winning captains Dhoni, Kapil Dev watch US Open match together, pic viral
28.article_body: India's World Cup-winning captains MS Dhoni and Kapil Dev were spotted watching Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner's US Open men's quarter-final match. Reacting to video that surfaced online showing Dhoni and Kapil watching the match at Arthur Ashe Stadium, a fan tweeted, "They're being identified and getting roars even in US." Kapil also shared a picture of him with Dhoni.

29.title: Sabalenka wears sunglasses at press conference to hide tears after losing US Open semi
29.article_body: World number six Aryna Sabalenka wore sunglasses and a cap at the press conference to hide her tears after losing the US Open women's singles semi-final against world number one Iga Swiatek. The 24-year-old lost the semi-final with a scoreline of 6-3, 1-6, 4-6. "Can't begin to imagine how horrible she feels," a fan tweeted.

30.title: Appreciate Rahul Gandhi’s endeavours: Meghalaya Governor Malik
30.article_body: Meghalaya governor Satya Pal Malik praised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi saying he "appreciates his endeavours" and said he "hoped" the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will "have some good outcomes for the country". Malik added that the nation's security will be impacted if "its military and farmers were not strong". He also criticised the renaming of Delhi's Rajpath to 'Kartavya Path'.

31.title: Ex-Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains' bail application rejected in rape case
31.article_body: A court in Punjab's Ludhiana on Friday rejected the bail application of Lok Insaaf Party leader and former Punjab MLA, Simarjeet Singh Bains, in a rape case. Bains' brother and personal assistant, who were also co-accused in the case, had been bailed out on August 12 and 25, respectively. A 44-year-old woman alleged that Bains had raped her multiple times.

32.title: Everyone who called him genius should be jailed: Kangana on Brahmastra director
32.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has shared a post on her Instagram Stories criticising 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji. "Everyone who called @ayan_mukerji a genius should be jailed immediately," Kangana wrote, adding, "He took 12 years to make this film, he replaced 14 DOPs...he shot for more than 400 days for this film and changed 85 ADs and burnt ₹600 crores to ashes."

33.title: Hrithik gets angry & shouts at fan after he forcibly takes selfie with actor, video viral
33.article_body: A video shows Hrithik Roshan getting angry after a fan forcibly took a selfie with him. The incident took place when he was leaving a theatre with his sons. Hrithik is seen standing outside his car when the fan blocked his son's way and broke past the security for a selfie. "What are you doing?" Hrithik can be heard shouting.

34.title: Need to be flexible in our batting: Harmanpeet ahead of 1st India-Eng T20I
34.article_body: Ahead of first India Women-England Women T20I, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said her side needs to be flexible in their batting approach in T20Is. On closing out the matches, Harmanpreet said, "We are working on that. I know for a long time these things are troubling us. We need to show some patience." First T20I will be played on Saturday.

35.title: Video shows Raj man attacking employer with sharp weapons after being sacked
35.article_body: A video showing a man attacking his employer with sharp weapons along with his friends after being allegedly sacked from his job has gone viral on social media. The men in the video are then seen running away from the spot on bikes. The incident reportedly took place in Rajasthan's Kota. The man has reportedly suffered injuries.

36.title: 39.5 kilograms of heroin worth ₹197 crore seized near Kolkata port
36.article_body: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) and Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) detected 39.5 kilograms of heroin worth ₹197.82 crore in 72 hidden packets in Kolkata. "The contraband was found concealed inside 12 gear boxes which were part of 7,220 kilograms of metal scrap sent from Jebel Ali Port in Dubai in a shipping container...[that] reached Kolkata port," Gujarat DGP said.

37.title: Assam CM posts musical video to mock Rahul Gandhi; Congress reacts
37.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday mocked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi by posting a musical video on Twitter in which Rahul was portrayed as a cartoon character. The video, entitled 'Rahul naam mera', included references to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. In response, Congress leader Srinivas BV posted an earlier viral video showing Sarma scratching himself and tweeted, "Himanta naam tera."

38.title: RPF jawan saves woman from going under moving train in UP; video out
38.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a Railway Protection Force (RPF) jawan saving a woman from getting under a speeding train in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad. The video showed the woman crossing a railway track and trying to get onto the platform. The jawan was seen rushing towards her and pulling her onto the platform seconds before the train passed.

39.title: All football games in England postponed until Monday, cricket to go ahead
39.article_body: All football fixtures in England have been postponed until Monday due to the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, English football's ruling body announced. However, cricket fixtures were suspended on Friday but will resume on Saturday, including the ongoing Test match between England and South Africa. The government has stated that there is "no obligation" to postpone events.

40.title: Kapil Sharma's 'Zwigato' to screen at Busan Film Festival
40.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma's film 'Zwigato' is all set for its Asian premiere at the 27th Busan International Film Festival. The news was shared by Applause Entertainment, the production house bankrolling 'Zwigato', on their Instagram handle. The Nandita Das directorial was earlier screened at the Toronto International Film Festival. Kapil plays a food delivery partner in the movie.

41.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is for spreading hatred: BJP leader
41.article_body: BJP MP Jugal Thakor Lokhandwala has criticised Rahul Gandhi's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said it is 'Nafarat failayo Yatra'. "This journey of Rahul Gandhi is to spread hatred," he said. "The way Congress has done the work of dividing the country into caste, region and religion for 60 years, even today, they want to run the same politics," Lokhandwala added.

42.title: Queen Elizabeth's state funeral will be UK's first since 1965
42.article_body: The state funeral that'll be accorded to the late Queen Elizabeth II will be the UK's first such funeral since 1965, with Winston Churchill being the last head of state to get the honour. The Queen's husband Prince Philip was given a royal ceremonial funeral. A state funeral begins with the body of the deceased brought on a gun carriage.

43.title: 3rd England-SA Test to resume on Saturday after suspension due to Queen's death
43.article_body: The third and deciding Test between England and South Africa will resume at The Oval on Saturday after the play was suspended on Friday following Queen Elizabeth II's demise. "All players...coaches will wear black armbands," the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) said. After the opening day's play was washed out, Saturday's play will be considered to be Day 3.

44.title: 4 people killed after car falls into gorge in Uttarakhand
44.article_body: Four people from Maharashtra were killed and two others injured when the car in which they were travelling fell into a gorge near Shree Ram Tapasthali Ashram in Tehri Garhwal, Uttarakhand. The deceased have been identified as Shivaji Budhkar (53) from Mumbai, Purushottam Dattatreya (37) and Jitesh Lokhande (43) from Thane, and Dharmaraj from Palghar, police said.

45.title: Gambling ring busted in Karnataka's Kalaburagi; 7 held, cash seized
45.article_body: Police have arrested seven persons for gambling in a public space while playing a game of 'Andar Bahar' near Shahabazar Naka in Karnataka's Kalaburagi. Police also seized the deck of cards, along with cash of over ₹1 lakh, they added. The Kalaburagi City Police tweeted and shared the details of the case, along with a press note and pictures.

46.title: 15 passengers injured after 2 buses collide in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
46.article_body: At least 15 passengers were injured when a government bus collided with a minibus of a private transport service in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Friday, police said. The accident took place in the afternoon when the bus was travelling to Jalandhar from Pathankot, police added. Ten of the injured passengers were discharged from community health centre after getting first aid.

47.title: Was called 'lady Akshay Kumar' as I was doing 4-5 films in a year: Rakul
47.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh in an interview called herself a "workaholic" and said, "When I was working in Telugu films, I did four-five films in a year." "People would jokingly call me 'lady Akshay Kumar'," she added. "I live, breathe and dream cinema, so I'm extremely grateful that I have work. I will never say no to work," said Rakul.

48.title: DK was dropped without any fault of his, Ind should have trusted him: Jaffer
48.article_body: Former cricketer Wasim Jaffer commented on the Indian team's move to drop wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik from the playing XI for majority of the Asia Cup matches. "Karthik was dropped without any of his faults. He didn't even bat in the matches he played...I think team India will be hurt that they didn't show that trust in Karthik," Jaffer said.

49.title: 12-yr-old boy killed in leopard attack in UP's Balrampur
49.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was killed in a leopard attack in Pachperwa town in Balrampur, UP. The incident took place on Thursday night when the deceased, Aman, was returning home, police said. The forest department has been directed to catch the leopard and a team of officials has been sent to provide financial compensation to Aman's family.

50.title: Under no pressure to breach 90m mark: Neeraj after Diamond Trophy win
50.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, who became the first-ever Indian to win Diamond Trophy after throwing 88.44 metres, said he's under no pressure to breach the 90 metres mark. "It'll happen when it has to," he added. "Medal is more important than the mark. People don't remember the distance, they remember where you finished on...podium," he further said.

51.title: 'Corrupt' to meet same fate as 'rioters': UP CM Yogi Adityanath
51.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday warned the 'corrupt' saying they would meet the same fate as 'rioters'. Criticising the previous governments, he said, "The 'daam' (price) of every 'kaam' (work) was already fixed. The racket had made the entire system hollow, by acting like a weevil." "Corruption was in the genes of governments before 2017," he added.

52.title: What is the story behind the black-and-white photo used to announce Queen's death?
52.article_body: The news of Queen Elizabeth II's death was officially announced on social media with a black-and-white photo. According to People, the photograph was clicked more than 15 years ago during a milestone event in the Queen's life. It was clicked at Buckingham Palace in February 2006 for the Queen's 80th birthday by late photographer Jane Bown.

53.title: Ashish Nehra names his Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022
53.article_body: Ex-India fast bowler Ashish Nehra has named his Team India squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Nehra included Ravindra Jadeja, Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravichandran Ashwin as spinners in the squad. He also named both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik in the squad. Nehra further said that he would want Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul to open in the tournament.

54.title: Didn't use my chances: Sabalenka on US Open semis loss vs Swiatek
54.article_body: After failing to get past a Grand Slam semi-final for the third time in her career at US Open 2022, world number six Aryna Sabalenka said she didn't use her chances against top seed Iga Swiatek on Thursday. "She was playing aggressively," she added. It was the fourth time in 2022 that Sabalenka was defeated by the 21-year-old Pole.

55.title: Feels like we have lost our own 'Grand mother': Vaughan on Queen's demise
55.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan shared his views on the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. "Feels like we have all lost our own Grand mother xxxxx," Vaughan tweeted. "She loved sport, be honoured to play in her memory," England's current Test skipper Ben Stokes tweeted. Former English cricketer Ian Bell also offered his condolences on the Queen's demise.

56.title: Mill worker dies after colleague pumps air into his rectum in MP
56.article_body: A mill worker died after his colleague allegedly pumped air into his rectum with an air compressor machine that was being used to clean flour dust in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. The accused, who was arrested on Friday, had done it "with an intention of fun", according to police. The victim had asked the accused to help him clean his back.

57.title: Country's politics should be free from dynastic politics: Assam CM
57.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday criticised Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao and said the country's politics should be free from dynasty politics. Speaking in Hyderabad, Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "CM KCR speaks about BJP-free politics but we speak about dynasty-free politics." "We still see pictures of his son and daughter in Hyderabad," Sarma added.

58.title: Which Indians have slammed hundreds in all formats in international cricket?
58.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday became the fourth Indian cricketer to smash hundreds in all three formats in international cricket. Suresh Raina had become the first cricketer to achieve the feat in 2010. Rohit Sharma became the second Indian to slam hundreds in all three formats in 2015. Meanwhile, KL Rahul became the third Indian to achieve the feat in 2016.

59.title: Tripura SIT to probe Bangladeshi infiltration after 27 arrests
59.article_body: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) of Tripura Police will probe the infiltration from Bangladesh into the state after 27 allegedly illegal foreign nationals were detained near Agartala earlier this week. Officials said the move will ensure better coordination between the police and central government agencies. An official said infiltration is being reported from the state's unfenced border areas.

60.title: Cristiano Ronaldo mourns Queen Elizabeth II's death, says 'Irreplaceable loss'
60.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo took to Instagram to condole the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Calling it an "irreplaceable loss", he wrote, "Seven years of my career were played in the Premier League, making this my 8th season living in England. Throughout these years, I've felt the everlasting love of the UK for its Queen."

61.title: SC to begin hearings on criminalising marital rape from Sept 16
61.article_body: The Supreme Court said it will on September 16 hear pleas arising out of the Delhi HC's split verdict on criminalising marital rape. "Otherwise also, this matter has to be heard," said the bench. The HC had delivered a verdict with one judge favouring striking down the exception in the law while the other refused to hold it unconstitutional.

62.title: Army, Air Force conduct 4-day 'Gagan Strike' exercise in Punjab
62.article_body: The Army's Kharga Corps and the Air Force conducted a joint exercise called 'Gagan Strike' over the last four days in Punjab. The exercise comprised deploying attack helicopters in support of ground forces and practising annihilation of enemy defences, a defence spokesperson said. The Apache 64E and Advanced Light Helicopter WSI were used by the Air Force.

63.title: CUET-UG results to be announced by September 15: UGC Chairman
63.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) is expected to announce the CUET-UG results by September 15 or if possible, even a couple of days earlier, University Grants Commission (UGC) Chairman Jagadesh Kumar said on Friday. The Common University Entrance Test for undergraduate admissions (CUET-UG) was conducted in six phases from July 15-August 30. CUET-UG answer keys were released on September 8.

64.title: Virat Kohli will always be remembered as the greatest cricketer: Akhtar
64.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said Virat Kohli will always be remembered as the "greatest" cricketer, following his 71st international hundred in the match against Afghanistan. Akhtar further termed Kohli as a man made of "steel", adding his wife Anushka Sharma is an "iron lady". "You always support the truth and that's why nothing bad will happen to you," stated Akhtar.

65.title: Jeff Bezos criticises US professor for wishing Queen Elizabeth an 'excruciating' death
65.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos criticised an associate professor at US' Carnegie Mellon University who said she wished UK's Queen Elizabeth faced "excruciating" pain on her death bed. "This is someone supposedly working to make the world better?" said Bezos on Uju Anya's tweet, adding, "I don't think so." The Queen passed away in Balmoral Castle, Scotland on Thursday.

66.title: Self-proclaimed SP student leader tries to block UP CM's convoy, detained
66.article_body: A self-proclaimed Samajwadi Party (SP) student leader was detained for trying to block the convoy of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Jaunpur on Friday. The accused broke the police cordon and suddenly appeared in front of the convoy waving a black flag and raising slogans in favour of SP chief Akhilesh Yadav. He was immediately taken away by police.

67.title: I have stopped working with A-list actors: Filmmaker Prakash Jha
67.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha has said he has stopped working with A-list actors. "They don't want to work with me either," he added. "I don't want to finish a film in 30 days...because the actor wants to move on to another project. I want to do my project the way I want. Many don't want to work on...difficult script," said Prakash.

68.title: Told Serena 'No disrespect to this generation but you're so much better': Sharapova
68.article_body: Five-time Grand Slam champion Maria Sharapova said she told Serena Williams when the pair met at 2021 Met Gala that there's no disrespect to the current generation of tennis players but "you're so much better". "I'm glad that she had a chance here [US Open 2022]," she added. The 23-time Grand Slam champion was defeated in US Open third round.

69.title: Hugh Jackman's 'The Son' gets 10-min standing ovation at Venice Film Fest
69.article_body: Hugh Jackman and Laura Dern-starrer 'The Son' received a 10-minute standing ovation at Venice International Film Festival on Wednesday. The film, directed by Florian Zeller, centres on "a family as it falls apart and tries to come back together again", according to Sony Pictures Classics' official synopsis. Actors Anthony Hopkins and Vanessa Kirby are also part of 'The Son'.

70.title: 4 men open fire at street dogs in Madhya Pradesh; case registered
70.article_body: A case has been registered against four unidentified persons after they allegedly opened fire at street dogs using air guns at a locality in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. A video of the incident showing the accused firing shots at the dogs went viral on social media. No canines were, however, injured in the firing, police said.

71.title: Old days of Lalu Yadav's regime are back in Bihar: Sushil Modi
71.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi commented on the alleged increasing incidents of murder in the JD(U)-RJD-ruled Bihar. "Recently, incidents of murder took place in Patna. It seems like the old days of Lalu Yadav's regime are back," Modi said. He added, "He (Bihar CM) met Lalu Yadav, the symbol of crime and corruption. They can't handle law and order."

72.title: We are for corporate India but against massive monopolies: Rahul
72.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that his party is for "corporate India" but "against the idea of massive monopolies". "India now faces a bankruptcy of vision for what the future of our country should be...We are against unfairness, be it against farmers or MSMEs. We will act to ensure fairness prevails," Rahul tweeted.

73.title: TMC leader Mondal, 13 others acquitted in 2010 WB poll violence case
73.article_body: A Kolkata court on Friday cited "lack of evidence" while acquitting Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Anubrata Mondal and 13 others in the 2010 Mangalkote poll violence case. In 2010, CPI(M) activists were allegedly injured in a clash with TMC supporters in West Bengal. The prosecution couldn't prove that the accused were present at the scene of violence, the court held.

74.title: Pakistan's Asif Ali, Afghanistan's Fareed Ahmad fined 25% of match fee for their fight
74.article_body: Pakistan's Asif Ali and Afghanistan's Fareed Ahmad have been fined 25% of their match fee each for their altercation during their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match. Ahmad gave Asif a send-off after dismissing him, after which Asif pushed and almost hit Ahmad with the bat. The players admitted their offence and accepted sanctions proposed by match referee Andy Pycroft.

75.title: Man confronts Assam CM on stage during Hyd rally, dismantles mic
75.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma was allegedly confronted by a man, who dismantled the microphone on the stage at a rally in Hyderabad on Friday, as per reports. The man has reportedly been identified as a worker of the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) party. He was later taken off stage by BJP leaders and workers present there, reports added.

76.title: Earth spiralling towards multiple 'irreversible' climate tipping points: Study
76.article_body: With the current warming rate, Earth might cross several climate tipping points by the 2030s, a study has found. According to researchers, climate tipping points are threshold conditions beyond which climate change becomes irreversible and "self-perpetuating". To cut risks and maintain liveable conditions on Earth, greenhouse gas emissions must be reduced rapidly, starting immediately, they said.

77.title: Nepal captain Sandeep issues statement after being accused of rape, says 'I'm innocent'
77.article_body: Nepal cricket team captain Sandeep Lamichhane, who has been accused of raping a 17-year-old girl in a hotel room in Kathmandu, issued a statement, saying he is innocent. He added that he will be taking a break from Caribbean Premier League and go back to Nepal. "May justice be served to the innocent and right investigation be done," he stated.

78.title: Rohit interviews Virat Kohli after his 1st hundred in nearly 3 years, BCCI shares video
78.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma interviewed Virat Kohli after the latter slammed his first hundred in nearly three years. After Rohit asked a question in Hindi, Kohli jokingly responded, "He's speaking in pure Hindi with me for the first time." In the interview, Kohli talked about how the team management gave him space and helped him amid his poor form.

79.title: Army's forward posts along LAC in Arunachal Pradesh to get helipads
79.article_body: Infantry battalions guarding the Line of Actual Control (LAC) with China in Arunachal Pradesh are going to get helipads capable of operating Chinook helicopters for swift mobilisation of troops and military equipment, senior military officials said on Friday. "We're...giving a big push to the infrastructure development in the forward areas in the eastern sector," a Mountain Brigade Commander said.

80.title: Hard to comprehend Queen Elizabeth is no longer with us: World Athletics Prez
80.article_body: Condoling the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, World Athletics President Sebastian Coe tweeted, "The Queen was such a beloved constant in the lives of so many people over so many years that it's hard to comprehend that she's no longer with us." He added, "I'll never forget her total commitment to...success of the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games."

81.title: Royal gun salutes of 96 rounds, marking each year of Queen's life, fired across UK
81.article_body: A day after Queen Elizabeth II passed away on Thursday, Royal gun salutes took place at various places, including London, Belfast, Cardiff and Edinburgh, in the UK. The salutes saw the firing of 96 rounds, marking each year of the Queen's life. The UK is observing a 10-day period of official mourning, starting today (September 9).

82.title: I'm going for everything: Jabeur on her 2nd Grand Slam final at US Open
82.article_body: After reaching her second straight Grand Slam final at US Open 2022, Tunisia's Ons Jabeur said the Wimbledon final was tough for her, adding that she's "going for everything" against world number one Iga Swiatek in Saturday's final in New York. Jabeur became the first African woman to reach the final at US Open in the Open Era.

83.title: BJP has made Bengaluru a city of shutdowns: Karnataka Congress
83.article_body: The Karnataka unit of Congress criticised the BJP's state unit for the ongoing flood crisis in Bengaluru. "From the silicon & startup capital of India, BJP has ensured we have become the city of shutdowns. The government's inefficiency is hurting our city," Congress tweeted. A photo stating "infrastructure disconnected" was also shared by Congress in the tweet.

84.title: BJP is responsible for it: NCP leader on Yakub Memon's grave controversy
84.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil has held the BJP responsible for the controversy over beautification of 1993 Mumbai blast convict Yakub Memon's grave. "It's important to see during whose tenure permission was granted to build his grave," Patil said. "[It] was built when BJP was in power in Centre and also in Maharashtra. They are responsible for it," he added.

85.title: Yo Yo Honey Singh pays ₹1 crore alimony for divorce settlement
85.article_body: Rapper Yo Yo Honey Singh's divorce with Shalini Talwar has been finalised. He has paid an alimony of ₹1 crore for the divorce settlement. In 2021, Shalini Talwar had alleged domestic violence, mental harassment, cheating and financial fraud against Honey Singh, following which he had issued a statement saying "the truth will be out soon".

86.title: Have done nothing wrong, cooperated fully: Think tank CPR on I-T raids
86.article_body: Days after the Income Tax Department conducted searches at the Delhi office of the Centre for Policy Research (CPR), the think tank on Friday said, "We hold ourselves to the highest standards of compliance and are confident that we've done nothing wrong." "We have extended full cooperation to the department...and will continue to do so in the future," they added.

87.title: President Murmu launches 'Pradhan Mantri TB Mukt Bharat Abhiyaan'
87.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu virtually launched the 'Pradhan Mantri TB Mukt Bharat Abhiyaan' on Friday to strengthen the mission to eliminate tuberculosis from India by 2025. The President noted that India has more than 25% of the total TB patients of the world. The campaign seeks to bring together all community stakeholders to support TB patients who are on treatment.

88.title: People like CM Baghel only want to fill treasures of Congress: JP Nadda
88.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda criticised Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel and said people like him are against development and only want to fill Congress' treasures. "Our tribal brothers were killed here and...Baghel was with Rahul Gandhi in Kerala," Nadda said. "These days, [he] is going to 'Bharat Jodo' rallies, they need to first align their own party," he added.

89.title: Was surprised: Badshah on Apple using his Voodoo song at Far Out event
89.article_body: Rapper Badshah, speaking about Apple using his 'Voodoo' song at the Far Out event, said he was happy and surprised to see his song being used at the event. "I'm really happy...that Voodoo has crossed over and has such a long life," he added. Badshah's song with J Balvin and Tainy was used to unveil the brand's latest AirPods.

90.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
90.article_body: The IMD has issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states over next few days. It's very likely over Andhra Pradesh, Puducherry and Telangana on Saturday. It's likely over Odisha on September 10 and 11, West Bengal on September 11 and 12, and Gujarat from September 11 to 13. Maharashtra and Goa may witness it over next five days.

91.title: NGT imposes ₹200 cr fine on Ghaziabad civic, development bodies
91.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed fine of ₹200 crore on Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam (municipality) and Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) for "far from satisfactory" management of sewage waste. The municipality's liability will be 75% and the GDA's will be 25%. The tribunal said the two city bodies are liable to pay compensation for restoration of environment.

92.title: Conductor slaps, kicks passenger out of KSRTC bus; video surfaces
92.article_body: A video has surfaced online, purportedly showing the conductor of a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus allegedly slapping and kicking a passenger out of the vehicle in Dakshina Kannada district. KSRTC authorities have issued a disciplinary inquiry against the bus conductor and suspended him from duty. As per reports, the passenger was in an inebriated state.

93.title: How freaking good is this: Anushka on 'Vikram Vedha' trailer
93.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to her Instagram Stories to praise the trailer of 'Vikram Vedha', an upcoming Hindi film starring Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan in the lead roles. "How freaking good is this trailer! Two favourites in one film, totally killing it, Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan," she wrote. The film is set to release on September 30.

94.title: Reply to pleas against Places of Worship Act in 2 weeks: SC to govt
94.article_body: The Supreme Court granted the Centre two weeks' time to respond to petitions challenging sections of the Places of Worship Act, 1991. The bench accepted all pleas filed in the matter, including Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind's intervention plea. The original plea challenges the law prohibiting changes in the character of a place of worship from what it was on August 15, 1947.

95.title: Delhi govt to restore, beautify 50 lakes: Dy CM Manish Sisodia
95.article_body: Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said that the Delhi government will restore and beautify 50 lakes under its limits to turn them into recreational spots for tourists and citizens. Sisodia reviewed the Sannoth Lake restoration work in Bawana on Thursday. Recycled water from the sewage treatment plant in the Ghogha drain is being used to revive the lake.

96.title: Principal suspended after video shows students cleaning school toilet in UP
96.article_body: The principal of a primary school in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia was suspended after a video showing students being forced to clean a toilet surfaced on social media, an official said. Block Education Officer of Sohaon was asked to probe the matter. The video reportedly showed a man scolding children and threatening to lock the toilet if they did not obey.

97.title: 17 kids, 2 teachers fall ill allegedly due to foul smell from cowshed in UP
97.article_body: A total of 17 students and two teachers from a school in Dankaur area of Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar fell ill on Thursday. The school's director has alleged that due to a lack of cleanliness in the nearby cowshed, a foul smell was enveloping the school, as a result of which, the students and teachers have fallen ill.

98.title: Navneet Rana defaming me: Maha girl allegedly caught in 'love jihad'
98.article_body: A 19-year-old woman from Maharashtra's Amravati, who had reportedly gone missing, sparking 'love jihad' allegations, has come out and said MP Navneet Rana is "defaming" her. The woman said she had not eloped and had left her house to inquire about some educational courses. The woman's parents had filed a missing person complaint leading to the detention of a man.

99.title: Guard of children's home booked after specially-abled boy killed in Mumbai
99.article_body: Weeks after four minor boys allegedly beat a 16-year-old specially-abled inmate to death at a children's home in Mumbai, the police have registered a case of negligence against the security guard. "The guard was not present in the isolation room to supervise their behaviour," an official said. The guard has been booked under Section 15 of Juvenile Justice Act.

100.title: Strict action will be taken: CM Shinde on Yakub Memon's grave beautification
100.article_body: Responding to the controversy over the beautification of 1993 Mumbai blast convict Yakub Memon's grave, Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said that strict action will be taken against the persons responsible. "Yakub Memon...cannot be glorified. We won't accept this or let it happen," Shinde said. "I've informed BMC and...police, the Home Ministry will take appropriate action," he added.

101.title: Man threatens to blow up mosque & shoot its cleric in UP; arrested
101.article_body: A 25-year-old man named Mohammad Samad has been arrested for allegedly threatening to blow up the Jama Masjid in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly and shoot the cleric of the mosque, police said on Friday. A threat letter had been pasted on the mosque's wall because the cleric had not allowed the accused to play DJ in Eid Milad-un-Nabi procession, police added.

102.title: Pune-Nashik high-speed rail project is a priority: MP Amol Kolhe
102.article_body: The Pune-Nashik high-speed railway project is getting priority at all levels as it will connect northern and southern states, running through key industrial areas, Shirur MP Amol Kolhe said. "We are hoping it will prove to be the fastest railway project in terms of execution," he said. The project's land acquisition has been completed in four villages of Haveli taluka.

103.title: He's better off at no. 3: Pujara on Kohli's batting position in T20 WC
103.article_body: When asked if Virat Kohli, who scored his first T20I century in Asia Cup against Afghanistan, should open the innings in T20 World Cup, Cheteshwar Pujara said the India batter is better off at the number three spot. "KL Rahul...Rohit Sharma I think they make a good pair...as an opening...partner," he added. Kohli opened India's innings alongside Rahul against Afghanistan.

104.title: 1,183 gms of gold worth ₹61.62 lakh seized at Hyderabad airport
104.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport caught a male passenger who was smuggling gold and have seized 1,183 grams of gold valued at ₹61.62 lakh. The passenger was trying to smuggle the gold in the form of paste by concealing it in undergarments and socks, Hyderabad Customs tweeted.

105.title: Swiggy agent, Hyd man attack each other with knife over late delivery
105.article_body: A Swiggy delivery agent was allegedly attacked by a customer with a knife for being late in Hyderabad amid heavy rains on Thursday. After being attacked, the agent reportedly took the knife from the customer and attacked him with it. The customer, Shiva Prasad, received neck injuries and was hospitalised. The police are yet to trace the delivery agent.

106.title: BJP shares pic of Rahul's ₹41,000 Burberry t-shirt, Congress replies
106.article_body: BJP on Friday shared a picture of Rahul Gandhi wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which purportedly costs ₹41,257, while on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. BJP's Twitter handle shared the picture and said, "Bharat, dekho! (Bharat, look!)." Congress responded to the tweet, saying, "If you want to discuss clothes, the discussion will move towards (PM Narendra) Modi ji's ₹10 lakh suit."

107.title: King Charles to be formally proclaimed as Britain's new monarch on Saturday
107.article_body: King Charles will be officially proclaimed as Britain's new monarch at a meeting of the Accession Council at St James's Palace on Saturday, Reuters reported citing Buckingham Palace. Charles, Queen Elizabeth II's eldest son, automatically became King upon his mother's demise. He left for London from Balmoral Castle in Scotland on Friday.

108.title: Russian airstrike hits hospital in Sumy, several wounded: Ukraine
108.article_body: A Russian airstrike hit a hospital in Ukraine's Sumy region on Friday morning, the region's Governor Dmytro Zhyvytsky said. The building was destroyed and several people were wounded in the strike, he added. The hospital is reportedly located in the Velyka Pysarivka district, which lies on Ukraine's border with Russia. Moscow had previously denied allegations that it has targeted civilians.

109.title: It's a wrong thought process: Sehwag on India dropping Shami from T20Is
109.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag said that management's move to drop pacer Mohammad Shami from the Asia Cup was a "wrong thought process". "Two years ago, even [Ravichandran] Ashwin wasn't in your plans...When Avesh [Khan] was unavailable, Shami [should] have played. I understand you want to give youngsters a chance, but in Australia you also need experience," Sehwag said.

110.title: Rohit, Dravid don't fancy Shami in T20Is: Ajay Jadeja
110.article_body: Former cricketer Ajay Jadeja said that Indian skipper Rohit Sharma and coach Rahul Dravid "don't fancy" pacer Mohammad Shami in their T20I plans. "It is clear that [they]...want to play in a certain way. So, it doesn't matter what I think of Shami and it is too late to make that change now," Jadeja said.

111.title: 4 arrested with cough syrup worth ₹1.42 lakh in Palghar
111.article_body: Four persons were arrested allegedly with cough syrup worth ₹1.42 lakh in Palghar, Maharashtra. The accused were allegedly carrying several boxes of cough syrup in a tempo and were later arrested after they could not give satisfactory answers on the consignment, an official said. They have been charged under Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, the official added.

112.title: Mumbai man molests woman doctor on moving train; arrested
112.article_body: A man was arrested in Mumbai's Goregaon for allegedly molesting a 26-year-old female doctor on Pune - Mumbai CSMT Intercity SF Express. "The complainant alleged the accused...sitting next to her touched her waist. First, she assumed it was accidental...[and] went near the door. After some time, the accused also went there and again allegedly touched her," a police official said.

113.title: Be amongst the first to get the latest iPhone 14: Croma
113.article_body: Croma shared that pre-booking for iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus, iPhone 14 Pro, and iPhone 14 Pro Max is now live on croma.com. Select customers from Mumbai, Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, and Kolkata can get their iPhones, except the iPhone 14 Plus, delivered before 9:30 am on the day of the sale, September 16, it added.

114.title: Kohli scoring runs is huge bonus for India: Rahul after India batter's 122*
114.article_body: Praising India batter Virat Kohli after his 122* (61) in Asia Cup 2022, teammate KL Rahul said the 33-year-old scoring runs is a huge bonus for his side. "He must be pleased with his batting today. He has been working on his game since the last two-three series," he added. It was Kohli's first international century since November 2019.

115.title: PVR to seek stakeholders' nod on Oct 11 for merger with INOX
115.article_body: Amid the merger talks between multiplex operators PVR and INOX Leisure, PVR has called a meeting of its shareholders and creditors on October 11 to seek their approval for the same. The Mumbai bench of National Company Law Tribunal in August asked PVR to call the meeting. Both companies received clearances for the merger from NSE and BSE in June.

116.title: Her one-liners were legendary: Twinkle on Akshay's mom's 1st death anniversary
116.article_body: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna on Thursday shared a post on her Instagram handle, remembering her late mother-in-law, Aruna Bhatia, on her first death anniversary. She also shared a picture with Aruna that also featured Akshay Kumar. Twinkle wrote, "There was only one real tigress. The rest of us paled in comparison. Her one-liners were as legendary as her generous heart."

117.title: 3 detained for having undocumented cash in B'luru; ₹76 lakh seized
117.article_body: Bengaluru's City Crime Branch detained three people on Wednesday for keeping undocumented cash in their possession on a road. The accused were gesturing to each other and were apparently waiting for someone on the road, police said. They are suspected of being involved in a crime in Wilson Garden area, police added. Police seized cash worth ₹76 lakh from them.

118.title: Haasan mourns Queen Elizabeth II's demise, recalls her visit to his film's set
118.article_body: Kamal Haasan, mourning the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, tweeted, "I was saddened to hear the news of the death of Queen Elizabeth II." He also recalled Queen Elizabeth II's visit to the sets of his unfinished film 'Marudhanayagam' and said it was "probably the only film shoot she attended". Queen Elizabeth II visited sets of Haasan's movie in 1997.

119.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' undertaken to undo damage done by BJP-RSS: Rahul
119.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday criticised BJP and said the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is being undertaken to undo the damage done by BJP-RSS in the country. "Everybody has an opinion, BJP has one, RSS has its opinion," he said. "For us, the Congress, this is a journey and an attempt at understanding what's going on in India," he added.

120.title: NTPC shares near record high after deal with Army to supply renewable energy
120.article_body: After NTPC Limited announced that it has signed an agreement with the Indian Army to supply renewable energy, its shares gained ₹2.6 or 1.6% to ₹169.4 apiece on BSE on Friday. The Army's Western Command signed a long-term agreement with NTPC to draw 25 MW of solar power directly from the National Solar Grid for the next 27 years.

121.title: Myntra to hire 16,000 people to meet festive season demand
121.article_body: Fashion e-tailer Myntra has announced that it will hire around 16,000 people directly and indirectly to meet the demands of the upcoming festive season. Nupur Nagpal, Chief Human Resources Officer, said the company is looking at a 45% increase in seasonal job creation with over 6,300 people to aid in first-mile and mid-mile logistics and over 3,000 for last-mile deliveries.

122.title: 35-yr-old woman dies as fire breaks out in shop in UP's Shamli
122.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was charred to death after fire broke out at a grocery shop in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district on Friday. According to SHO Anil Kumar, the victim was sleeping in the shop while her husband, Sajid, was in the upper storey when the fire broke out. Sajid claimed the fire broke out due to an electrical short-circuit.

123.title: Industries in Pune's Chakan shifting to railways to transport goods
123.article_body: The Federation of Chakan Industries in Pune has met senior railway officials to discuss increasing the volume of goods being transported through the rail network. "Due to rising fuel prices impacting road transport cost...we will now move to railway transport," said Dilip Batwal, Secretary of the federation. The federation is planning to shift to railways in a phased manner.

124.title: Madras HC acquits man who carried heroin thinking it was wheat flour
124.article_body: The Madras High Court acquitted a man who was caught carrying heroin at the Chennai airport in 2014. The court accepted his claim that he thought the packet he was asked to carry by another person contained wheat flour and tamarind. He was earlier convicted and sentenced to 10 years of imprisonment by a trial court.

125.title: Eastern parts of Pune to face water cut on September 11
125.article_body: Some areas in eastern Pune will face a water supply cut on September 11. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) along with MSEDCL will carry out maintenance work at Bhama-Askhed pumping station. As per PMC, the areas to be affected include Lohegaon, Viman Nagar, Vadgaonsheri, Kalyaninagar, Vishrantwadi, Phulenagar, Yerawada, Kalas and Dhanori. The water supply will likely be back on Monday.

126.title: TIME honours Queen Elizabeth II with commemorative cover featuring her portrait aged 42
126.article_body: TIME Magazine released a commemorative cover in the honour of Queen Elizabeth II, who died on Thursday at the age of 96. The image on the cover was taken in 1968 when she was 42. In the photo, taken by British photographer Sir Cecil Beaton, the Queen can be seen in the Admiral's Boat Cloak.

127.title: Russia is preventing access to Ukraine war prisoners: UN
127.article_body: The head of UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine, Matilda Bogner, said that Russia is not allowing access to Ukrainian prisoners of war (POWs). "This is all the more worrying since we have documented that prisoners of war in the power of Russia...and held by...Russian armed forces or by affiliated armed groups have suffered torture and ill-treatment," she added.

128.title: Man arrested for cheating people of ₹2.5 cr on promise of jobs in Assam
128.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Assam for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of providing them jobs. The accused, identified as Dipjyoti Das, pretended to be an employee of Indian Oil Corporation Ltd and demanded money from people by promising them jobs at the company's Noonmati unit in Assam. He had duped 31 people of ₹2.5 crore, police said.

129.title: 6 arrested, stolen valuables worth ₹6.65 lakh recovered in Thane
129.article_body: The Thane Police arrested six persons for their involvement in 11 theft cases in Rabodi and Naupada police station limits and recovered valuables worth ₹6.65 lakh, police said. The recovered items included three auto-rickshaws, one mobile phone, one two-wheeler, jewellery and cash. "The modus operandi was that they...targeted the houses that were not covered by CCTV systems," police added.

130.title: I'm in same place where we spent many evenings: Vivek remembers Sushant
130.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri on Thursday posted a picture with late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on social media. He wrote in the caption, "Remembering Sushant Singh Rajput. Am exactly at the same place where we spent many evenings talking about life, cosmos, God's particle, Shekhar Kapur's 'Paani' and struggles of a middle class, small town person in Bollywood."

131.title: Man suspects father has illicit relations with wife, kills him in MP
131.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly murdered his 70-year-old father using an axe in Madhya Pradesh's Katni, police said on Thursday. "[The accused] suspected that his father was having illicit relations with his wife. After a dispute, he hit his father...with an axe," a police station in charge said. The incident took place on Tuesday.

132.title: Everyone used to ask me to play Hansa at school functions: Supriya's daughter
132.article_body: Sanah Kapur, actress Supriya Pathak's daughter, said when she was in middle school, her mother's character from 'Khichdi', Hansa, had become "quite a rage". She added everyone used to ask her to play Hansa during her school's annual functions. "I used to...hate it...I was terrible (at it) and I didn't want to do...mom's role because that's insane pressure," said Sanah.

133.title: UP govt should focus on improving condition of madrassas: Mayawati
133.article_body: Former UP CM Mayawati on Friday criticised the state government's decision to conduct a survey of madrassas. "The government should focus on improving the condition of government-aided madrassas and government schools," she tweeted. She said that while exploitation of Muslims under the Congress rule was usual, their oppression by BJP after coming to power is sad and condemnable.

134.title: Labourers find abandoned newborn in bushes in Kerala; probe on
134.article_body: A group of migrant labourers found an abandoned newborn girl in the bushes after they were startled by a cry while searching the area for discarded things in Kerala's Alappuzha on Friday. A probe has been launched to find the mother of the infant. The infant has been taken to a state-run hospital, according to the police.

135.title: 80-yr-old killed, 300 vehicles burnt as fire breaks out in J'khand showroom
135.article_body: An 80-year-old woman was killed while about 300 two-wheelers worth crores were burnt after a fire broke out in a showroom in Jharkhand. The fire broke out on Thursday night, reports said. Reports added that fire tenders were deployed to put the fire off. Police said that the fire appears to have been started due to a short circuit.

136.title: History has been created, a world of its own: Shanaya on 'Brahmāstra'
136.article_body: Actress Shanaya Kapoor took to Instagram Stories on Friday to appreciate Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva'. She wrote alongside a poster of Ranbir and Alia, "Ayan Mukerji, thank you for creating this experience. History has been created. A world of its own." The film also features Amitabh Bachchan, Dimple Kapadia, Mouni Roy and Nagarjuna.

137.title: Warden absconds after sexually abusing 7 minor boys in Hyderabad
137.article_body: A warden in a hostel of Sri Chaitanya school in Hyderabad is absconding after allegedly sexually assaulting about seven minor boys. According to police, 32-year-old Krishna allegedly used to sleep alongside the boys and would touch them inappropriately when they were asleep at night. The parents raised the issue with the management after which Krishna was removed from his job.

138.title: Senior ISIS militant captured in Turkey: Prez Erdogan
138.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that a senior member of the Islamic State militant group has been captured in Turkey. The operative, who's code-named Abu Zeyd, was captured in an operation carried out by police and Turkey's intelligence agency, who were monitoring his connections in Syria and Istanbul and had received intelligence that he'd enter Turkey illegally, Erdogan added.

139.title: Court realised hollowness of case: Journalist Kappan's wife on SC verdict
139.article_body: After Supreme Court granted bail to Kerala journalist Siddique Kappan, his wife Raihana expressed her happiness over the verdict. "We cannot explain the trauma we had gone through the last two years. Now...Supreme Court has realised...hollowness of the case," Raihanna said. Kappan was arrested in 2020 while on his way to Hathras to cover a Dalit girl's gangrape and murder.

140.title: What remains constant is gratitude I feel every b'day: Akshay Kumar
140.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Friday took to social media to share a picture of himself to thank fans for their wishes and love on his birthday. He wrote alongside the picture, "Years keep passing by, time keeps moving on. What remains constant is the gratitude I feel on every birthday. Thank you always for all your love."

141.title: Won't attend Filmfare Awards, I don't go to such shitty places: Vivek
141.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri revealed that he wasn't invited to Filmfare Awards this year. He added he'll not attend the award ceremony next year even if he gets an invite. "I don't go to such shitty places," he said, adding, "These awards [have]...become a fashion show, comprising star kids." Vivek further said he'll not become a part of the "corrupt system".

142.title: Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa: The Rise' inspires Ganpati Pandal in Maharashtra
142.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media which shows a Ganpati Pandal in Maharashtra using Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise' as a theme. The pandal was on the topic of Dahi Handi and the skit introduced characters talking in the style of characters from the film. The Ganesh idol was unveiled with a poster of Allu's character Pushpa.

143.title: Tamil Nadu man carries mother's body to crematorium in wheelchair
143.article_body: A 60-year-old man carried the body of his 84-year-old mother to a crematorium in a wheelchair in Tamil Nadu's Tiruchirapalli on Thursday. According to a crematorium official, Muruganandham said he felt no one would help him since his mother suffered from psoriasis, a skin disease. Muruganandham also said he had no money for the funeral, added the official.

144.title: India, China to complete disengagement in Gogra-Hot Springs by Sept 12: MEA
144.article_body: India and China will complete the disengagement process in the Gogra-Hot Springs area in eastern Ladakh by September 12, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. "The two sides have agreed to cease forward deployments in this area in a phased, coordinated...verified manner, resulting in the return of the troops of both sides to their respective areas," MEA added.

145.title: SC refuses to hear plea over arrest of Nupur Sharma for Prophet remarks
145.article_body: Supreme Court refused to hear a plea seeking the arrest of former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for her remarks on Prophet Mohammed. "Court should be circumspect while issuing directions. Our suggestion is, withdraw this," Chief Justice of India UU Lalit said. Sharma had earlier moved the SC seeking merging of cases against her for her remarks against the Prophet.

146.title: 11 lakh pilgrims visit Kedarnath Dham in 126 days, footfall breaks record
146.article_body: Breaking the previous record, 11 lakh pilgrims are reported to have visited the Kedarnath Dham in 126 days. "A record number of passengers have arrived on this visit. The Yatra was affected due to [COVID-19] for two years but this time the yatra is being conducted duly," District Magistrate (DM), Mayur Dixit, said.

147.title: Mumbai's BEST starts 'seat reservation' for airport bus services
147.article_body: Passengers can now book their seats on BEST's airport bus services before travelling from the Mumbai airport. One can use BEST's Chalo app to reserve their seats from September 9, an official said. The air-conditioned electric buses will ply from International Airport (T2) to various areas throughout the night. According to the official, these buses are a more cost-effective option.

148.title: Airline staffer mishears 'ballast' as 'blast', sparks security scare at Bhopal airport
148.article_body: An alert was sounded at Bhopal's Raja Bhoj International Airport on Thursday after an IndiGo employee misheard the word "ballast" as "blast" in an inquiry call. The caller inquired about a ballast (extra load used to balance aircraft weight) on a Hyderabad to Agra flight travelling via Bhopal. Passengers were made to deboard the flight and security systems were activated.

149.title: 8 tree-fall incidents recorded due to rain in Pune on Sept 7: PMC
149.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) tweeted on Thursday that eight tree-fall incidents were reported on September 7 as the city witnessed continuous rainfall. The civic body added that no one was injured in the incidents, however, two of the trees fell on four-wheelers and damaged the vehicles. Earlier, India Meteorological Department issued a 'yellow' alert for Pune till September 11.

150.title: Ganesh Visarjan begins in Hyderabad; pics emerge
150.article_body: Several Ganesh Visarjan (idol immersion) processions were taken out in Hyderabad on the tenth day of the Ganesh festival on Friday. Hyderabad Traffic Police shared visuals of the Bada Ganesh idol as the visarjan procession started in Khairatabad. It also shared pictures of the procession of Balapur Ganesh. Visuals of idol immersions at Tank Bund Road have also surfaced online.

151.title: This is the path of duty: Kangana on Rajpath being renamed Kartavya Path
151.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut attended the unveiling of Delhi's renovated Rajpath-Kartavya Path on Thursday. Speaking about the renaming, the actress said, "Many generations will lead by example and walk on it." She added, "If you keep the name Rajpath, it will not lead by example but the Kartavya Path is the path of duty, this will serve as guidance to people."

152.title: Delhi's Deen Dayal college holds part of professors' salaries citing lack of funds
152.article_body: Delhi government-funded Deen Dayal Upadhyaya College released only a part of professors' salaries for July, citing a lack of funds. It has retained ₹30,000 from the net salaries of assistant professors and ₹50,000 from those of associate professors/professors. "The same will be released as and when the funds are available," the officiating principal of the college stated in a notice.

153.title: Mumbai man forced to pay ₹5.28 lakh after woman records his intimate video
153.article_body: A 54-year-old man from Mumbai was forced to pay ₹5.28 lakh to blackmailers after a woman he befriended on Facebook told him to strip and recorded his intimate video. Reports said the woman had threatened the man to make his video viral. He also got a call from a fraudster posing as CBI official saying that the video was online.

154.title: Eiffel Tower, Empire State Building honour Queen Elizabeth II
154.article_body: The Eiffel Tower in Paris went dark on Thursday night in honour of late UK Queen Elizabeth II. The Empire State Building in New York was lit up in purple and silver to honour the life and legacy of the Queen. The Queen, Britain's longest-serving monarch, died at the age of 96 at Balmoral Castle in Scotland on Thursday.

155.title: Passenger vehicle sales rise 21% in Aug as chip supply improves
155.article_body: Passenger vehicle wholesales in India reported a 21% annual growth with 2,81,210 units dispatched to dealers in August as against 2,32,224 units in August last year, the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) data showed. This was driven by improved supplies of semiconductors and festive demand. Total two-wheeler wholesales also witnessed a 16% growth to 15,57,429 units last month.

156.title: Last photo of Queen Elizabeth II shows her at Balmoral Castle 2 days before her death
156.article_body: A final photograph of Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away aged 96, shows the monarch smiling and clutching a walking stick while standing next to a fireplace at the Balmoral Castle. The picture was clicked on Tuesday, two days before her death, when she officially appointed Liz Truss as the new UK PM. It was clicked by photographer Jane Barlow.

157.title: He adds another feather to his cap: Anurag on Neeraj Chopra's Diamond Trophy
157.article_body: After javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra became the first-ever Indian to win the Diamond League final,  Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter and wrote, "Neeraj Chopra adds another feather to his cap." He added, "You've taken Indian Sports to new heights with your superb performances...Congratulations Champ!!" Neeraj threw 88.44 metres to win the Diamond Trophy in Zurich on Thursday.

158.title: US seizes $30 mn in crypto from N Korea-linked hackers: Chainalysis
158.article_body: US authorities have seized over $30 million in crypto stolen by North Korea-linked hackers Lazarus during Axie Infinity hack, blockchain analysis firm Chainalysis said. "This marks the first time ever that cryptocurrency stolen by a North Korean hacking group has been seized," it stated. Seizures represent around 10% of roughly $615 million in crypto stolen in the hack, it added.

159.title: Nobody would've survived so long: Gambhir on Kohli's ton after nearly 3 yrs
159.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Virat Kohli should "realise" that he scored his 71st international hundred after nearly "three years" and not three months. "Three years is a very long time...Let's be fair, I don't think anyone would've survived for this long," added Gambhir. Kohli scored 122*(61) against Afghanistan to record the milestone, registering the highest individual T20I score by an Indian.

160.title: Romanian Navy ship with 75 onboard hit by drifting mine in Black Sea
160.article_body: A Romanian Navy dredger was hit by a drifting mine it was trying to defuse in bad weather on Thursday in the Black Sea, the country's Defence Ministry said. The 75 crew members onboard the ship were unharmed following the explosion, the ministry added. Mines began floating in the Black Sea after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

161.title: Amid Ganesh Visarjan, IMD issues yellow alert in Pune till September 11
161.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert in Pune till September 11. The district is expected to see heavy rain, thunder, lightning and gusty winds, IMD said. District administration has advised people to stay indoors during thunderstorms and lightning amid Ganesh Visarjan. It has also urged them not to hide beneath trees and stay away from electric poles.

162.title: Singapore's Whampoa Group to invest $100 mn via fund for digital assets
162.article_body: Singapore's Whampoa Group is looking to invest $100 million through a venture capital fund in startups in the digital assets segment, its executives told Reuters. Whampoa's digital assets investment arm, Whampoa Digital, will invest in equity and tokens of products or services and incubate early-stage startups in Web3. Whampoa is a multi-family office with investments in global tech firms.

163.title: Proud to be part of historic work: 'Kartavya Path' worker after meeting PM
163.article_body: Neeraj Kumar, one of the 16 workers who were part of the Central Vista Avenue redevelopment, said, "With...redevelopment of the entire stretch, I've also become...part of this historic work." "People will come here and see my work forever. I feel proud to have been a part of it," the 25-year-old worker from Bihar said after meeting PM Narendra Modi.

164.title: North Korea passes law allowing it to carry out nuclear attack if threatened
164.article_body: North Korea has passed a law allowing it to carry out a preemptive nuclear attack to protect itself. With the new law, "the status of our country as a nuclear weapons state has become irreversible", leader Kim Jong-un said. Kim in July said his country was "ready to mobilise" its nuclear capability in any war with US and South Korea.

165.title: Akshay had jumped to save person who put his feet on open electric cable: Vipul
165.article_body: Filmmaker Vipul Shah said that actor Akshay Kumar had once, without thinking of his own safety, jumped to save a person who had put his feet on an open electric cable. "There was a risk of being electrocuted, but he just pulled the person out of the situation," he said, adding that Akshay looks after his crew.

166.title: Whether I'll become Congress Prez or not will be clear after party polls: Rahul
166.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi during a media conference amid the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Friday said that whether he will become the party President or not will become clear when the party conducts the election. He added that he has made his decision about if he will contest the party's election or not and that there is "no confusion".

167.title: Hyd's 21-kg Balapur laddu auctioned for ₹24.6 lakh during Ganesh Chaturthi
167.article_body: The 21-kg famous laddu of Balapur in Hyderabad was auctioned for ₹24.6 lakh on Friday morning during the Ganesh Chaturthi festivities in Telangana. The auction was won by Vengeti Laxma Reddy of VLR builders. Reports said that this was the 29th year of holding an auction of the laddu. In 1994, the laddu was reportedly auctioned for ₹450.

168.title: 'The Crown' is a love letter to Queen Elizabeth II: Show's writer
168.article_body: 'The Crown' writer Peter Morgan has stated that the Emmy-winning drama series is a "love letter" to Queen Elizabeth II. The Queen, who was Britain's longest-serving monarch, passed away on Thursday at the age of 96. Peter further said, "I've nothing to add for now, just silence and respect. I expect we will stop filming out of respect too."

169.title: Los Angeles declares September 17 as 'Squid Game' Day
169.article_body: Los Angeles has officially designated September 17 as 'Squid Game' Day to commemorate the influence of the Korean drama series on American pop culture. The resolution passed by the city council states the series made history "by becoming the first Korean and first foreign language series to be nominated at the Screen Actors Guild Awards [and] bringing home three wins".

170.title: PMC to construct another bridge on Mutha river at a cost of ₹45 cr
170.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will construct one more bridge on the Mutha river to connect the Sinhagad Road to Karvenagar as proposed in the Development Plan of the city, a PMC official said. The project, which is estimated to cost ₹45 crore, will divert a lot of traffic from the main Sinhagad Road, the official added.

171.title: Improve hospitals for treatment of burn victims: NCW asks J'khand govt
171.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has directed the Jharkhand government to "improve hospital infrastructure" for the treatment of burn victims. This comes after a fact-finding committee visited the state to investigate a 15-year-old girl's death who was set ablaze by her stalker. The committee found two hospitals, where the victim was taken for treatment, to be lacking basic infrastructure.

172.title: I got wickets wherever I was bowling: Bhuvneshwar Kumar on his 5/4
172.article_body: Having recorded his career-best figures of 4-1-4-5 in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said he was able to pick wickets "wherever" he bowled. "It was my day...The white-ball [usually] doesn't swing much but it...swung a lot today," added Bhuvneshwar. Bhuvneshwar broke the record for picking the most wickets for India in T20Is, overtaking Yuzvendra Chahal.

173.title: IIT Delhi launches app to enable city people to report flooding in real time
173.article_body: IIT Delhi has launched a mobile application to enable the residents of the national capital to report flooding in real time. Reports said that this will help researchers in developing an early warning system to predict urban floods. The app, called IITD Aab Prahari, has been developed as part of the Civil Engineering Department's Water Security Hub project.

174.title: India declares 1-day state mourning on Sept 11 over Queen Elizabeth II's demise
