"The SC has recognised turbans worn by Sikhs as one of...five essential components of Sikhism," Justice Hemant Gupta said. Carrying of the kirpan is recognised by the Constitution, he added.

349.title: ICC announces T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up fixtures
349.article_body: ICC today announced warm-up fixtures for the men's T20 World Cup 2022 that will begin in October in Australia. India will face hosts and reigning champions Australia in their first warm-up match on October 17 at The Gabba. India will face New Zealand two days later at the same venue. Pakistan will face England and Afghanistan in their warm-up fixtures.

350.title: Husband, wife & son try to kidnap 7-yr-old girl in UP; villagers save her
350.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was saved by villagers in UP's Belipar village after three members of a family, who worked as sanitation workers, tried to kidnap her. The three people, including a husband, wife and son, tried to lure the girl with a toffee while she was on her way to school. The kidnappers were caught after the girl started crying.

351.title: New era has begun in the form of Kartavya Path: PM Modi
351.article_body: PM Narendra Modi after inaugurating the revamped Central Vista Avenue said a new era has begun in the form of Kartavya Path. The Rajpath (formerly 'Kingsway') and Central Vista lawns area has been renamed Kartavya Path. "Symbol of colonialism, 'Kingsway', is history now and it has been erased forever," PM Modi added.

352.title: Meta, Twitter to testify in US panel on social media's impact on homeland security
352.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta, Twitter, YouTube and TikTok will testify on September 14 at the US Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Government Affairs on social media's impact on homeland security. The committee said it'll be an opportunity to understand the extent to which these firms' business models contribute to amplifying harmful content. Panel will also hear from former Facebook executives.

353.title: Security given when Yakub was buried, whose govt was it then?: Aaditya
353.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday refuted the BJP's claims that the former Maharashtra government under ex-CM Uddhav Thackeray was responsible for the alleged beautification of terrorist Yakub Memon's grave. "Why was Yakub Memon not dumped at sea like Osama Bin Laden? Whose government was it then? When he was buried, great security was provided," Thackeray told reporters.

354.title: Kohli smashes an international hundred after 1,019 days, records his 1st T20I century
354.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday smashed his first-ever T20I hundred, reaching the three-figure mark off 53 deliveries against Afghanistan in Asia Cup 2022. Kohli has hit an international hundred after 1,019 days. Kohli has now equalled former Australia captain Ricky Ponting's tally of 71 hundreds in international cricket.

355.title: Nawazuddin & Aaliya Siddiqui to team up for Teejan Bai's biopic
355.article_body: Producer Aaliya Siddiqui has roped in Nawazuddin Siddiqui to play one of the main characters in Chhattisgarh's veteran folk artiste Teejan Bai's biopic. Calling the film her "dream project", Aaliya said Nawaz has been a huge admirer of Teejan Bai's work since his theatre days. Aaliya said it will be her honour to bring Teejan Bai's story to the audience.

356.title: Some artificial sweeteners may be linked to heart diseases: Study
356.article_body: As per study, consumption of some artificial sweeteners may be associated with a greater risk of overall cardiovascular diseases. Researchers analysed artificial sweeteners in regular food products and found that aspartame present in it was linked to an increased risk of cerebrovascular events, while acesulfame potassium and sucralose were associated with a greater risk of coronary heart disease.

357.title: How did Tanishka become NEET UG 2022 topper despite 4 candidates scoring same marks?
357.article_body: Four candidates (Tanishka from Rajasthan, Vatsa Ashish Batra from Delhi, Hrishikesh Gangule and Rucha Pawashe from Karnataka) scored 715 out of 720 marks in NEET UG 2022. However, Tanishka was declared the topper due to the new tie-breaker policy which considers nine factors, including giving preference to candidate scoring higher marks/percentile in Biology, followed by Chemistry and others.

358.title: Firsts are always special: Kajol on OTT debut show 'The Good Wife'
358.article_body: Actress Kajol Devgan will be playing a lawyer in her debut web series 'The Good Wife'. Talking about it, Kajol said, "I have been playing multiple characters throughout my acting journey, but the firsts are always special." She added that OTT platforms allow creators and actors to reinvent and experiment, which is an opportunity she got with 'The Good Wife'.

359.title: JP Agarwal replaces Mukul Wasnik as MP Congress in-charge
359.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi appointed JP Agarwal as the Congress in-charge for Madhya Pradesh in place of Mukul Wasnik. Wasnik will reportedly continue as AICC general secretary but will oversee other organisational matters. "Congress president has accepted the request of Mukul Wasnik to relieve him from his responsibility as general secretary in-charge of Madhya Pradesh," a party statement said.

360.title: They didn't understand: Palash on being trolled for Atif Aslam post
360.article_body: Singer Palash Sen said people haven't understood his post on Atif Aslam. The singer, who was trolled for stating that Atif had "maximum impact on Bollywood", said he wanted to urge people to start asking bigger questions. "As Indians, we give so many opportunities to everybody, but I don't think we get the same reciprocation from other countries," he said.

361.title: Dynamic & huge: Madhavan on trailer of Vikram Vedha's Hindi remake
361.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has reacted to the trailer of the Hindi remake of 'Vikram Vedha', which stars Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan in the lead roles. Madhavan, who played Vikram in the film's original version, called the trailer "dynamic and huge". He said he "can't wait to see" the Pushkar-Gayatri directorial in theatres on September 30.

362.title: 30 students in Andhra hospitalised after complaining of suffocation
362.article_body: At least 30 students of a school in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada district fell ill and were hospitalised on Wednesday after they complained of suffocation, according to reports. A few of the affected students reportedly also fell unconscious but all of them are now in stable condition. The students had reportedly complained of a foul smell in the classroom.

363.title: HDFC Bank raises ₹3,000 crore from bonds to fund business growth
363.article_body: Private sector lender HDFC Bank on Thursday said that it has raised ₹3,000 crore from bonds to fund business growth. The bank issued and allotted bonds to investors on a private placement basis on Thursday. These unsecured, subordinated, fully paid-up and non-convertible, Basel III compliant perpetual debt would carry a coupon rate of 7.84 per cent, it added.

364.title: Man hacked to death by Nihang Sikhs near Golden Temple for chewing tobacco
364.article_body: A factory worker was hacked to death by three men, including two Nihang Sikhs, over chewing tobacco on a street in Golden Temple's vicinity on Wednesday night. CCTV footage shows the three engaging in a fight with the man before he's hacked to death. One accused was arrested, and raids are being carried out to apprehend the remaining suspects.

365.title: India's fuel demand rises 16.3% in August to 17.81 million tonnes
365.article_body: India's fuel demand rose 16.3% in August as compared to the same period a year ago to 17.81 million tonnes, government data showed. Petrol sales were 11.6% higher from a year earlier at three million tonnes. Liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) sales increased 3% to 2.39 million tonnes, while naphtha sales surged 23.5% to 1.16 million tonnes.

366.title: Reliance-backed Netradyne receives $65 mn from Silicon Valley Bank
366.article_body: Reliance-backed software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Netradyne has received $65 million in debt financing from US-based Silicon Valley Bank (SVB). The Artificial Intelligence (AI) software provider was founded in 2015 by Avneesh Agrawal and David Julian. So far, Netradyne has raised $197.5 million from investors such as Reliance, Softbank, Point72, Microsoft Corp and Hyundai.

367.title: Scientists discover new solar system that could be home to alien life
367.article_body: A new planetary system with two distant planets orbiting around a small, cool star named LP 890-9 has been discovered. The planets, called LP 890-9b and LP 890-9c, take 2.7 and 8.5 days to complete one revolution around the star, respectively. The latter is also within the star's "habitable zone", making it neither too hot nor cold for alien life.

368.title: MPPSC aspirant turns into fruit chaat seller due to delayed results
368.article_body: A 28-year-old civil services aspirant has opened a fruit chaat stall with his friends in Indore due to the delayed results of Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC) examinations, a report said. Tejprakash Kushwaha, who is preparing to take the 2021 Mains exams, said, "My family's financial condition isn't stable." Meanwhile, another MPPSC aspirant has started selling samosas in Indore.

369.title: Synchronised response to lower inflation is the best approach: RBI ED
369.article_body: Reserve Bank of India Executive Director (ED) Sitikantha Pattanaik on Thursday said a synchronised response to lowering inflation is the best approach. Central banks can and must deliver price stability but there's a debate on whether they alone could deliver it, Pattanaik said. India had not seen "massive" fiscal interventions to ease prices as seen recently, he added.

370.title: PM interacts with Central Vista workers, invites them to R-Day parade
370.article_body: PM Narendra Modi interacted with workers involved in the redevelopment project of Central Vista during the inauguration event of 'Kartavya Path' in Delhi on Thursday. He told them that they will be invited to the Republic Day parade, ANI reported. PM Modi also unveiled a statue of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose at India Gate.

371.title: PM Modi inaugurates Kartavya Path, unveils Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's statue
371.article_body: PM Narendra Modi inaugurated the revamped Central Vista Avenue in the national capital on Thursday. Centre had recently announced that the Rajpath and Central Vista lawns area will be renamed 'Kartavya Path', which will exhibit improved public spaces and facilities including lawns with walkways and refurbished canals. He also unveiled Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's statue near India Gate.

372.title: World's earliest evidence of surgery found in 31,000-yr-old skeleton
372.article_body: A 31,000-year-old skeleton of a young adult found in Borneo in Indonesia underwent the world's first successful surgery, researchers have found. After analysing the leg bones of the skeleton, researchers confirmed that its lower left limb had been surgically amputated. Its healed bone confirmed the injury. The skeleton was found in the 40,000-year-old caves of East Kalimantan.

373.title: Devise policy for employment of transgender persons: SC tells Centre
373.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed Centre to devise a policy aimed at providing employment to transgender persons. Centre has been asked to consult with the National Council for Transgender Persons to formulate the policy. The court was hearing a plea by a transgender woman who alleged she was refused a job at Air India owing to her gender identity.

374.title: YouTube removed 13 lakh videos in India in Q2 2022, most of any country: Report
374.article_body: YouTube removed 13.24 lakh videos in India between April-June 2022, the most among 30 countries it listed in its Community Guidelines Enforcement Report Q2 2022. This is nearly thrice more than the videos YouTube removed in the US (4.45 lakh) and Indonesia (4.27 lakh). The report further stated that YouTube removed 75.43 crore comments of which, 98.9% were flagged automatically.

375.title: B2B SaaS platform Kovai.co appoints Andrew Cloke as COO
375.article_body: Enterprise software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Kovai.co has appointed Andrew Cloke as the new Chief Operating Officer. Cloke said that he would be working out of the company's UK office and "will be making regular trips to India". Founded in 2011, Kovai.co is a Coimbatore and London-based firm, and it reported an Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) of $10 million in 2020.

376.title: Southeast B'luru will be equipped to handle rains better: Minister
376.article_body: Karnataka IT Minister CN Ashwathnarayan on Thursday assured technology companies that by next monsoon southeast Bengaluru will be better equipped to handle severe rain. Southeast Bengaluru, which is home to several technology companies, was flooded in parts after heavy rains over the weekend. Ashwathnarayan said the government will examine implementing the ‘Elcita’ model to handle heavy rains.

377.title: Summer of 2022 was the warmest ever in Europe: Climate monitor
377.article_body: This year's summer (June-August) was the warmest in Europe's recorded history, said the European Commission's climate monitor on Thursday. The Copernicus Climate Change Service said temperatures in Europe were the "highest on record for both the month of August and the summer as a whole". As per data, this August was the warmest ever recorded by a margin of 0.4°C.

378.title: 2 shot dead, 2 injured over land dispute in Punjab's Ferozepur
378.article_body: Two persons were shot dead and two others were injured over a land dispute in Punjab's Ferozepur on Thursday. The deceased were identified as 60-year-old Balwinder Singh and 22-year-old Balraj Singh. "The two parties had been feuding over the land for two years. One of the parties, armed with guns, attempted to take forceful possession of the land," police said.

379.title: Delhi's Central Vista Avenue to have parking space for 1,117 cars
379.article_body: The new-look Central Vista Avenue will have a parking facility for 1,117 cars and nearly 35 buses. It also has designated areas for app-based taxis and auto rickshaws. Also, there will be eight new amenity blocks with new signages. These will include 64 female toilets, 32 male toilets and 10 accessible toilets for the differently abled.

380.title: Take it as responsibility, not burden: Edu Minister to students on reservations
380.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan told students questioning the quota policy to take reservations as their responsibility rather than a burden. "They (disadvantaged groups) clean our washrooms, and we call them untouchables. We've been doing it for centuries," Pradhan said. "And now that...we've provided them some assistance through affirmative action, we are questioning that?" he added.

381.title: Europe unveils hi-tech satellite to give quick extreme weather warnings
381.article_body: Europe on Wednesday unveiled the MTG-I1 satellite designed to give earlier extreme weather warnings. The satellite will be launched by the end of the year on an Ariane 5 rocket. The 3.8-tonne spacecraft will be joined in geostationary orbit by three more MTG-I imaging satellites and two MTG-S "sounding" satellites. It'll start sending images from next year onwards.

382.title: Nitish, Soren & I will come together for 2024 LS elections: Mamata
382.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that her counterparts from Bihar and Jharkhand, Nitish Kumar and Hemant Soren, will come together to oust BJP from power in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "All opposition parties will join hands to defeat...BJP...The [party's] arrogance of 300 seats will be its nemesis," she said while addressing a programme in Kolkata.

383.title: Bike-taxi services banned in Indore, over 1,000 such vehicles grounded
383.article_body: Citing safety and regulatory concerns, the Indore transport department has banned the operation of bike-taxis in Madhya Pradesh's biggest city, an official said on Thursday. Over 1,000 such vehicles in the city have been grounded, he added. "After an investigation into various complaints about bike-taxis, we found their operation is not safe," Regional Transport Officer Jitendra Raghwanshi said.

384.title: Minister Rajnath Singh, Japan's Hamada review defence ties
384.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met his Japanese counterpart Yasukazu Hamada in Tokyo on Thursday, reviewing bilateral defence cooperation and regional issues. The two ministers expressed commitment to continue multilateral military exercises including 'Malabar', 'Dharma Guardian' and 'JIMEX'. Later, Singh tweeted the meeting marked 70 years of diplomatic relations between the two countries.

385.title: India announce playing XI for match against Afghanistan; Rohit, Pandya, Chahal rested
385.article_body: Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi won the toss and elected to bowl first in their last Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against India. India have made three changes to playing XI, with regular captain Rohit Sharma, leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal and all-rounder Hardik Pandya being replaced by Dinesh Karthik, Axar Patel and Deepak Chahar. KL Rahul will lead India today.

386.title: European Central Bank makes its largest-ever interest rate hike of 0.75%
386.article_body: The European Central Bank (ECB) made its largest-ever interest rate increase of 0.75% on Thursday. "Over the next several meetings the Governing Council expects to raise interest rates further to dampen demand and guard against...risk of...persistent upward shift in inflation expectations," the ECB said. In July, it raised interest rates for the first time in more than 11 years.

387.title: Govt to acquire Vodafone Idea stake after share price stabilises at ₹10 or above: Report
387.article_body: The government will acquire around 33% stake in debt-ridden Vodafone Idea (Vi) after the stock price of the company stabilises at ₹10 or above, Hindustan Times reported quoting official source. The company's board has reportedly offered a stake to the government at a par value of ₹10 per share. Notably, Vi shares are trading below ₹10 since April 19, 2022.

388.title: UK cinema chain Cineworld files for bankruptcy in US
388.article_body: UK-based movie theatre chain Cineworld has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Texas, United States. The company has built up $4.8 billion in net debt and said that it would keep theatres open as it seeks to restructure the debt. Cineworld operates 751 movie theatres, and anticipates exiting from Chapter 11 during the first quarter of 2023.

389.title: DCW issues summons to Delhi Police over video showing children selling liquor
389.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women on Thursday issued summons to the city police over a video purportedly showing children selling illegal liquor and ganja. "This girl is selling the same while eating ice cream. This video was reportedly recorded in Rohini. The future of children is being ruined," DCW Chief Swati Maliwal tweeted along with the video clip.

390.title: 48-yr-old man cheats DU prof of ₹34 lakh on pretext of getting VC post
390.article_body: A 48-year-old man was arrested for allegedly cheating a Delhi University professor of ₹34 lakh promising to get him the post of Vice Chancellor at Srinagar University, police said on Wednesday. The accused had met the victim a few years back and had introduced himself as an influential person in politics, the professor said in his complaint.

391.title: Fire breaks out at makeshift office outside Dubai stadium ahead of India-Afghanistan match
391.article_body: A fire broke out at a makeshift outside the Dubai International Cricket Stadium ahead of India-Afghanistan Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match on Thursday. In videos that have surfaced online, fumes can be seen from inside the stadium. The fire was later doused and there won't be any affect on the match.

392.title: Latest ODI rankings released as England become world number one team
392.article_body: The ICC on Thursday released the latest ODI team rankings, with England displacing New Zealand from the top position. England are now on top with 119 rating points, while New Zealand, who have lost two ODIs in a row against Australia, are second with 117 rating points. India are the third-ranked side with 111 rating points.

393.title: NMMC demolishes under-construction illegal structure in Navi Mumbai
393.article_body: The anti-encroachment department of the Belapur ward of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has demolished an under-construction illegal structure in Shahbaz Gaon. As per a report, the civic body had served a notice regarding the unauthorised construction at house number 600/2. NMMC carried out the demolition drive after the construction was not removed despite the notice, the report added.

394.title: 3 students killed, 1 injured after being hit by truck in Rajasthan
394.article_body: Three students on their way to appear for B Ed examination were killed and another student was injured after they were hit by a truck on the Agra-Mumbai National Highway in Rajasthan's Dholpur, police said. The students were going to the exam centre on a motorcycle and had stopped by the roadside when the truck hit them, the SHO said.

395.title: BJP MLA injured, her relative killed as car collides with truck in MP
395.article_body: BJP MLA Leena Jain was injured and her 85-year-old relative was killed after their car collided with a truck in Vidisha district, Madhya Pradesh, on Wednesday night. Four other people also sustained injuries. The car collided with the truck while trying to save a cow on the road, police said. As per reports, the deceased was Leena Jain's mother-in-law.

396.title: Cong is trying to defame 'Brand Bengaluru' for petty gains: BJP
396.article_body: BJP leader Tejasvi Surya has criticised Congress for trying to defame "Brand Bengaluru" for their "petty gains". He added that only certain parts of Bengaluru have been flooded, but the Congress is trying to suggest that the entire city is flooded. The Karnataka unit of Congress had earlier criticised Surya for eating a dosa, while other citizens were struggling.

397.title: 35-yr-old Mumbai man held for siphoning off 1,850 iPhones worth ₹11 cr
397.article_body: A 35-year-old former employee of a Mumbai-based authorised Apple distributor, Manish Pujari, was arrested for allegedly siphoning off 1,850 iPhones worth ₹11.13 crore. Pujari surrendered after he was booked based on the complaint by Ingram Micro India Pvt Ltd. "Pujari was given the responsibility of developing relationships with the client and expanding business with them," an official said.

398.title: IT, BT firms also responsible for flood situation in B'luru: BJP leader
398.article_body: BJP leader NR Ramesh said information technology (IT) and business technology (BT) firms are also responsible for the flood situation in Bengaluru. Companies in Electronics City have encroached upon storm water drains completely or narrowed them, Ramesh said. He added that firms are threatening Karnataka government that they'll shift to Telangana. They won't survive there for a day, Ramesh said.

399.title: Indian and Chinese troops begin disengagement from Gogra-Hot Springs in Ladakh
399.article_body: Indian and Chinese troops have started withdrawing from Gogra-Hot Springs Patrolling Point-15 in Ladakh after reaching a consensus in the 16th round of military talks, the two sides said in a joint statement. This is "conducive to peace and tranquility in the border areas", the statement said. The 16th round of India-China Corps Commander level talks were held in July.

400.title: OPS has betrayed the party, he's like a chameleon: AIADMK's EPS
400.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Thursday criticised his party colleague O Panneerselvam. "He has betrayed the party. OPS is like a chameleon," EPS said. "OPS had led...violence at party HQ, how can the party cadre accept his return?" EPS said, adding elections will be held for the post of party's general secretary soon.

401.title: Allu Arjun did look trial; shoot begins by Sept 22: Pushpa 2 producer
401.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rule' producer Y Ravi Shankar said Allu Arjun did his look trial earlier this week for the upcoming Sukumar directorial. He informed that while Arjun's look will continue to be rustic, there will be a little change as compared to his look in 'Pushpa: The Rise'. Shankar added the film's shooting will start around September 22 in Hyderabad.
